intro: Chabraea candidissima, commonly known as the white chabraea, is a flowering plant native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit and clusters of small, white, fragrant flowers. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered with fine hairs. Chabraea candidissima is typically found in humid, shaded environments within the rainforest understory.
